Hello,

I am using Birt 2.2.0. The problem I have is that the event handler sets the variables correctly (as i see in the log file) but they are not passed to the report. Look at my test web site: http://gratiax21.fnal.gov:8880/birt-v22/
I will restart the tomcat and notice the variables displayed on top of the report after the parameter page entry. The first time they have the correct values, ifyou go back and ryn the rport again the values are wrong (the report displays with the default values). Also, notice that in the drill through link the hidden parameters are also displayed. I do not want the database url and user name/password  to be displayed.

Thank you
Penelope

Yufei Cheng:

Please take a look at this bug.

Thanks.

Can't reproduce this problem in I and Yufei Cheng's computer environment.

We have tried BIRT 2.2.0 Release RC4 and BIRT 2.2.1 current version. We have tried BIRT RCP package and BIRT codes. We have run BIRT directly and deployed BIRT to tomcate. We have tried the framset, run and preview model. Still can't reproduce the problem.

Ps: I can't visit the web site: http://gratiax21.fnal.gov:8880/birt-v22/. I have tried it, but the page cannot be displayed. 


Hi, Penelope Constanta:
I need your help to get more information.
1. Can the report, which one I have attached, works in your environment?
2. Which version tomcate and java you are using.
3. Is the BIRT, which you are using, 2.2.0 Release RC4 or other 2.2.0 version?
4. I have found the report your are using was created by a old version BIRT.
<property name="createdBy">Eclipse BIRT Designer Version 2.0.1 Build <20060222-1204></property> 
   Can you using the new version BIRT to creat a testing report and make a test again?
5. Have the "Enter Parameters" dialog popped every times when you view the report in tomcate?
6. Which model you were using to view the report: framst, run or preview? You can find it in the URL.

Thanks.

Have the "Enter Parameters" dialog popped every times when you view the > report in tomcate? > 6. Which model you were using to view the report: framst, run or preview? You > can find it in the URL. > > Thanks. > Hello, Let me answer your questions: 1. The problem I have is not running the report. The report works fine. I tried your simple report and it does work. 2. This behavior is the same on Linux and Windows under tomcat. On Windows I run "Apache Tomcat 5.5.23 Server" and I am using "java 1.6.01" and on the Linux I run "Server version: Apache Tomcat/5.5.16" and using "java 1.5.0_06" 3. To create the reports I am using the report designer under eclipse - Birt 2.2.0 from the all-in-one download and for the runtime the birt-runtime-2_2_0. I do not know where to look to find the build. 4. The report I am using was created by Birt 2.2.0 using the eclipse environment and it is my test report. The designer though does not put the correct version in the xml. All my reports have the same "Created by: Eclipse BIRT Designer Version 1.0.1 Build <20050815-0740>" but the report designer that I use (as taken from the Eclipse About...) is: BIRT Report Designer Version: 2.2.0.v20070604-7U7U-C-Qc-5jcp_VXDWwz-63 Build id: v20070626-0630 5. The "Enter parameters" dialog does come up all the times and the parameters I enter in the report are working just fine. Their values are passed correctly to the report. The parameters though set by the event handler are not passed to the report the second time after a tomcat restart. 6. I am using for my test the frameset method and I simply modified the example viewer to run my report instead of the test one. The only changes I made to the viewer are the following: a. added the jdbc driver under the C:\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 5.5\webapps\birt-v22\WEB-INF\platform\plugins\org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc_2.2.0.v20070615\drivers b. added my jar file with the event handler under C:\Apache Software Foundation\Tomcat 5.5\webapps\birt-v22\scriptlib c. the index.jsp of the example viewer was modified as follows (last lines): ------

Thank you for your choosing BIRT (Business Intelligence Reporting Tool).

Viewer Version : 2.2.0

Engine Version: 2.2.0

URL = <%=request.getRequestURL() %>

PATH=<%=request.getContextPath()+"/frameset?__report=JobsByVO.rptdesign"%>

Use custom parameter page for JobsByVO.rptdesign

">Use Birt parameter page for JobsByVO.rptdesign ----- The parameterInput.jsp is my custom parameter page using the tag library. The second link is using the Birt parameter dialog. Both give exactly the same results. As I explained before the problem has nothing to do with running the report. It has to do with setting the parameters using my java event handler (that I have attached) to set some hidden parameters. My report runs fine, the event handler runs fine, the problem is that they do not communicate. The java code in the event handler sets some parameters that the report is using as hidden required parameters. The first time after restarting the tomcat, all is well. The event handler sets the variables and the report picks them up correctly. If the report is called again on the same tomcat, even using a different browser, the parameters are set by the java code (as I can see in the log file) but are not passed to the report since in my test report I am displaying these variables to check them. The report is displayed using the default values for these parameters which some have correct default values and some don't. The parameters that are not hidden and I am changing using the "parameter dialog" are passed to the report with the correct values (those entered in the parameter dialog). It seems that some piece of code in the engine is not executed the second time... something like a variable is set to prevent it... Thank you Penelope

Additional information -- (In reply to comment #7)

Hello,

Thank you for your help so far. 
In order to demonstrate the problem I am seeing, please visit

http://gratiax21.fnal.gov/birt-v22

My user interface is not that good you  will need to use the browser's back button to go back to the menu of use a different browser window.

Thank you
Penelope

are you changed your event handler file? It seems that BIRT doesn't run the event handler.

Follows those steps:

1. download the event handler log file, the last traceTableKey is 1189151947754.
2. run the "BIRT parameter page for JobsByVO.rptdesign", it shows the report.
3. download the event handler log file again, find that the log file is not changed. The last traceTableKey is still 1189151947754.
4. run the "CUSTOM parameter page for JobsByVO.rptdesign", it shows the report.
5. download the event handler log file, find that the log file still not changed. the last traceTableKey is still 1189151947754.
6. run the report through preview mode(it will shows the errors in execution) through: http://gratiax21.fnal.gov/birt-v22/run?__report=JobsByVO.rptdesign.
7. It displays the error message at the bottom of report. 
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
 at net.sf.gratia.reporting.GratiaBirtReportEH.beforeFactory(GratiaBirtReportEH.java:60)
 at org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.script.internal.ReportScriptExecutor.handleBeforeFactory(ReportScriptExecutor.java:55)
 ... 47 more.

It seems that you uses a different version of event handler with the one attached in this entry. The parameter is changed in handleBeforeFactory and it throws exception before setting. So no log is outputted and no parameter value are changed.

can you fix the bug in the event handler and retry?

thanks.
Please ignore my previous comments, my browser cached the logger file. It do changes in report execution.

Hi, Penelope Constanta:

The bug can be reproduced at "http://gratiax21.fnal.gov/birt-v22". But I haven't reproduced in my environment.

I am attaching a testing case now. It includes six files:
OldJobsByVO.rptdesign		(a design file downloaded from http://gratiax21.fnal.gov/birt-v22)
New1JobsByVO.rptdesign	(Only change the eventHandlerClass form the OldJobsByVO.rptdesign)
New2JobsByVO.rptdesign	(Only change the eventHandlerClass form the OldJobsByVO.rptdesign)
New1EventTest.java		(The eventHandlerClass for the design file New1JobsByVO.rptdesign)
New2EventTest.java		(The eventHandlerClass for the design file New2JobsByVO.rptdesign)
events.jar			(The jar package which include the class file of the eventHandlerClass)

Can you help me to make a test?
Plese put the files New1JobsByVO.rptdesign, New2JobsByVO.rptdesign and events.jar into your Tomcat environment. So we can run the case at "http://gratiax21.fnal.gov/birt-v22".

Thanks.
